REVIEW: Mar 21 2009 	Caesars is a great experience if you can afford it . . . . .	We stayed here for 5 nights for a business conference so we didn't choose this hotel based on our own decision making. That said, I am REALLY glad we had the opportunity to stay here. We waited in line for almost a half hour to check in, but once we were there, we were treated quite well the entire time.The casino was nice and spread out. It wasn't too crowded. The food was truly amazing, but you pay for it. It is very expensive. We went to Bobby Flay's twice because it was soooo good. But lunch for two was $100.00The food court was great for the kids, even though the pizza pieces or hot dogs were $5.00 each, they really enjoyed them and the servings were pretty decent.We loved walking around the Forum shoppes and 'browsing'. There are a lot of great things to look at and the kids loved the shows.We even had a wonderful housekeeper who came every day at the same time. A lot of times the kids and I were still in the room and she was very kind. Very polite and friendly.The location was great, we walked over to the other nearby hotels and I always felt safe and comfortable.I really can't say enough great things about the hotel and our stay. We had a great time. We reviewed and looked at their website enough to know ahead of time what the prices would be to feed a family of five. If you go there knowing you are going to be spending a little more than other hotels then you are not disappointed or overwhelmed. Just go and have a great time!

Mar 21 2009 	Disappointed	From reading the reviews on Ceasar's it seems it depends on where you stay in the hotel. My husband and I paid $200.00 a night to stay in the Roman tower and I was so disappointed when I opened the door. The first room had no bathroom door and I refused to stay in a room like that so we were given another room down the hall which was probably a little worse but had a BR door. Everything must have been there since the Romans. It was old with cracked paint and door casings in the hall the carpet was not very clean and you couldn't use a calling card from the room. I live in Nova Scotia which is big in tourism and you wpuld find a better roon at Comfort Inn. We made the best of it and had a great time but I would be more selective the next time.

Mar 20 2009 	Its glory is past.	The current treachery propagated by Caesars involves enticing unwitting victims to their lair with the promise of low rates. However, the rooms associated with these rates are so miserable and uncomfortable, the guests are forced to pay extra ($50-60/night) to upgrade to more civilized rooms. The bed in the cheaper rooms (Roman Tower) is as comfortable as a sandpaper toga. If this is what the Romans slept on, no wonder their empire fell. Also, the staff at Caesars Palace is as warm, inviting and communicative as the many faux marble statues scattered throughout the casino. Actually that is not fair - the statues never did anything to anyone. Finally, if you do decide to brave one of the rooms in the Roman Tower, either travel alone or with someone you know very well. Otherwise, the complete lack of a bathroom door will make you closer than you ever wanted to be. I would not stay here again.

Mar 20 2009 	Was Very Shocked	My friend and I stayed at Ceasars for three very LONG days. Our room was HORRIBLE! Our toilet was not attached to the floor properly. Our view was of the airconditioning system. Our room was located above a bar and the music sounded as if it was in our room. Our beds sunk in the middle. Took FOREVER to get HOT water in the shower! Upon checkout I voiced my concerns about the room and was not taken seriously at ALL. I am not one to cause a scene. So when I arrived hom I called Ceasars and asked to speak to a manager and was pretty much told OH WELL! My husband and I are going back to Vegas in two months to celebrate our 15 wedding anniversary and guess where we will NOT BE STAYING? Can you say CEASARS!NEVER again will I spend my hard EARNED money in such a crappy hotel. I have stayed at Best Westerns with NICER ROOMS and BETTER SERVICE!On a happy note my friend and I transfered from Ceasars to THE RIO, and were treated like QUEENS!

Mar 18 2009 	We had an excellent time - large group of parents and teenagers!	We stayed in the Augustus Tower, room 3691. We had an excellent view of the strip and the Bellagio fountain, in the other distance were the mountains. It was like a TV show at night with all the lights and fountain shows. Our room was large, with a nice table, couch, chairs, large flat screen TV, and 2 double beds, very comfortable and large. The bathroom was overthetop luxurious. The two pools were excellent. With a large group of teens I would suggest sending someone out to bring in pizzas, salads, drinks, bagels, and fruit.

Mar 18 2009 	Worst service in Neros.	terrible food, terrible service I've ever had.The steak i've ordered in medium was burned out, no juicy at all.. and they swiched my steak to another dish, but still same..No waiter came to ask about may steak after that, Even I'd room charged my bill, they asked my ID because they didn't see my name, it was on the second line on the system,. they could find. and also I think could matched with sign card. Even they didn't appologize for inconvinient. Hotel room was great with view of bellagio.

Mar 17 2009 	Caesars Is At The Center Of All The Fun!	My wife and I just stayed at this awesome resort and will definitely stay there again. Check in was very quick, which I was a little nervous about because it is such a big resort. When checking in we upgraded to the Forum Tower which was great because it is right in the center of all the fun. Our room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. I have stayed at several Las Vegas resorts and the bed at Caesars was by far the best. The dining and shopping at the Forum Shops is great because there is a ton of variety. The only recommendation that I would give to someone staying there is if you want to go to the pool be sure and get down there early so you can find seating. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and invited us back which I am sure my wife and I will definitely be staying there again!

Mar 16 2009 	Great Hotel I couldn't have asked for more.	I stayed at Caesars on a solo trip from March 3rd to March 8th in the Augustus Tower. My whole stay was very good. The room was large and very nicely decorated in neutral tones. The pillows, sheets and bed were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was large and fully marble and spotlessly clean.Caesars is slap bang in the middle of the strip so one can't ask for a more central location.The restaurants and bars, shopping and gambling options are almost endless.I would definitely reccommend Caesars Palace to family and friends.I had a bit of an incident in the poker room one night and at my request I was tended to by the Casino Manager who sorted out the issue promply and professionally.The waitresses and slot attendants were very friendly and efficient. As a female travelling alone I felt totally safe at this hotel.Over all Caesars is a pretty good bet.

Mar 15 2009 	Some headaches but overall a good experience	Overall, my Caesars Palace experience was a good one. I went with a group of college friends for a few days, as we got a excellent deal on the hotel room. However, we believe that since we booked our hotel on a discount site (hotels.com), we were viewed as less important than other guests at the hotel when it came to service.When we called to confirm our reservation, we requested two adjacent rooms. However, when we checked in, they didn't even give us the type of room we paid for, let alone adjacent rooms. They promised a room switch at noon the following day when we brought this up at the desk, and said they'd be adjacent. Noon comes around and we find the new rooms aren't even on the same floor. Finally, we get them to put us in adjacent rooms (deluxe in the Augustus Tower, which is what we paid for) and they promise to call us between 3 and 5. At ten minutes to five, as they haven't called our rooms or our contact person's cell phone, our contact goes downstairs to find our rooms were ready. If we hadn't claimed them by 5, they would have been given to other guests. The room change was a headache.But incredibly worth it. The views were spectacular (we had a great view of the Bellagio fountains) and Caesars is excellently located with respect to other hotels and casinos, right in the middle of the strip. The coupon book we were provided with at check-in proved to help a lot, as we're college kids (lots of free food or discounts on meals).Both rooms were very clean and quiet, and the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom facilities in the first room (Palace Tower) were a little outdated, but still nice. The hotel was also very prompt in bringing extra towels and some amenities we'd forgotten (toothbrushes and deodorant).A small mix up also worked out in our favor. The previous guest in the first room we'd been assigned to had apparently spent a good deal of money in the casino and she'd been comped free food and bottles of water, all of which was sitting untouched and unopened when we arrived. When we mentioned this to the desk, they'd informed up she'd checked out and told us we were welcome to the food. Yay for free fruit and water after a long day of traveling!Additionally, the last full day of our stay, the pool reopened. Honestly, the pool alone may have made the trip for me, as I love to swim and Caesars' pools are gorgeous.

Mar 15 2009 	Absolute Vegas	We just came back from four nights in Vegas, first visit. Bought a very reasonable package out of Toronto, picked Ceasars Palace becouse I've seen pix in the magazines etc, and wanted to have a real Vegas Experience. We arrived at 9AM to check in, no line up, were told our package puts us into the old part of the hotel, tried the $20.00 trick to get a room upgrade to Augustus tower, somebody must've been watching, the young lady on the desk wouldn't go for it, so, after some negotiating we paid extra $25/nite for renovated room in the Palace tower, we got in right away! Nice, big, clean, renowated room with a double Jaccuzi tub, shower, lots of marble and nice towels and sheets too. 23 floor overlooking the parking lot, but high enough to see the pool at the Mirage and the Strip. Food at the hotel as elsewhere on the Strip expensive, but mostly good.The place is HUGE, takes 20 mins to walk from the lobby to the selfparking lot, we drove to the Red Rock Canyon, hiked for an hour, beautifull, then down to Hoover Dam, very intersting, all in one day, no rushing, recomend it! Also, spend an evening Downrown, after all the faux class of the strip, it felt somehow more real and a lot of fun, the light show on Fremont strreet is well worth the bus fare! Back at the hotel, check out the Forum shops, amazing details and workmanship, engeneering of the whole place is mindblowing, must have cost a fortune. We dont gamble, and after seeing what gamblers money can build, will never gamble for sure! We will go back in 10 years to see all the new buildings.

Mar 13 2009 	Outstanding Service!	On this short, one-night business trip, I found the level of service across the board to be exceptional at Caesars. From the reception clerk (Terran) to room service to the security guards, everyone was exceedingly friendly and helpful. Straight A's across the board - except: the bell desk was rather offhand about rental of a wheelchair (C+), and lost and found, which gets an A+ for going above and beyond, tracking down a beloved jacket and arranging to have it sent to this forgetful traveler.Also, I appreciated that guest rooms for those attending the conference were just an elevator ride away from the conference itself.

Mar 12 2009 	Casears is Las Vegas	It was our first trip to Las Vegas, and we were very glad that we stayed at Caesars. You seriously cannot beat the location as it is in the heart of the strip and within walking distance to almost all the other hotels. We booked a bare bones room through a travel site and when checking in, slipped the clerk a $20 bill and got upgraded to a suite in the Augustus Tower with a beautiful view of the strip. You would have to be crazy not to try the $20 trick...it is Vegas after all and it runs on tips. I read all the other reviews of Caesars before coming and was a little wary, but it is a fantastic hotel and while not as extravagant as a Bellagio or Palazzo, it is still a Vegas institution and definitely recommend it. Also, Spago in the Forum Shops was amazing, go there for a meal, you will not regret it!

Mar 11 2009 	new tower is very nice	check in offered to upgrade to the new Augustus tower for $40 a night so i took it I am gald i did. The room was very large nice plasma tv very well decorated no greek theme I liked that it was modern and nice evevators were fast. A few things about the room it was a bit noisy from loud neighbors, the bathroom amenities were very nice but i missed having qtips. The Qua spa was beautifulA few tips I saw Cher and it was great just do not by the really expensive cocktails in the theater not great. The gourmet chocolate shop wonderful and the cool machine in it spits out free chocolates every so often for you to sample. Noodle place was fantastic.

Mar 11 2009 	It was better than I thought...	My wife and I just got back from Vegas, we stayed there March 4-7th. We ended up getting to the hotel to check in around 430pm and we only waited around 10-15min. The front desk person tried to upsell us a different room and we declined because my dad purchased this room for us and we didnt want to pay extra money. We stayed in the Roman Tower and when we got to the room, we had mirrors on the cieling and a hot tub in the bedroom. Oh and a see through bathroom (nice touch) Our view from the room was of the pool that had constustion but we could see the sunset and a good view of the Palms (which is where we will stay next time) and the Rio. When we got to the room it was clean and we had no issues. I lived in Vegas for almost 2 years and I still got lost in this hotel. I started to figure it out only one day in but still. This place is huge. The only things we played at Caesar's was penny/nickel slots. We went across the street to O'Shea's to play table games since it was cheaper. We didnt eat anywhere in this hotel so I cant say anything about that but over all it was a nice room and the people working thier were kind. Dont even think about checking out at the front desk on a fri-sun, for its WAY to busy. We carried all our stuff downstairs and then saw the line at the front desk and I wold have been in line for like an hour. So we went back to the room...checked our balance and checked out through the TV...much easier. If you have any questions you can always ask me. I am a travel agent so I will give you all the info I have. Peace out from Dallas.

Mar 9 2009 	Serious Security Problems	Checked in to a large comfortable room, I had good expectations for my stay. I was awaken at 4am by loud noises in the hallway and someone banging at my door. I called security and they said "no problem, they would check it out." I never heard back from security. When I came out of my room in the am, the hallway was littered with smashed ice buckets. Other guests on the floor informed me that this was going on previous nights. I contacted the manager was moved to a room on another floor. The next night, someone entered my room at 4.30 am saying they were checked into this same room. A few minutes later, the bellman came to my door to collect my luggage. When I called the manager, they said I was not checked into this room. The next morning, I talked to another manager about the incident and they reported that I was checked into that room. When I returned from breakfast to my room, the key no longer worked. The serious security issues and the cavalier way the management handled my situation indicates problems. I wouldn't recommend a place where I didn't feel safe.

Mar 9 2009 	Great place to stay will do it again this year! Room was a comp deal...	Spent March 4th~6th in Vegas to celebrate my B-day. Caesars sent me an offer for 3 free nights plus $200 travel cash and the room that was booked on the offer was a deluxe room in the Forum Tower. Before I even arrived, they had upgraded me to a deluxe room in the Augustus Tower which I highly recommend to anyone booking a room there. The rooms are 650 sq. ft. and are essentially a mini-suite, they have very nice ammenities but the one thing they could certainly splurge on is toilet paper, that paper is rough! Overall (considering it was a free stay) I would recommend this hotel to anyone but the casino wasn't very generous to me. What are you gonna do though, this place wasn't built by giving money out to everyone that gambled there! Will probably stay there again this coming August when I return to Vegas.....

Mar 8 2009 	Great location and two-person showers - love it!	Stayed here for 5 nights in Feb - it was a good stay. We were upgraded at check-in to a suite in the Palace Towers. Single LCD TV, jacuzzi tub, 2 bathrooms with 2 toilets and a large two-person shower... awesome.The Palace Tower is nice, although if you can get a suite in the Augustus Tower, that would be nicer for the views. Our suite was looking at the new Octavius Tower that's almost done... surprisingly, there's not much construction noise.Pros:- Nice upgrade and suite - Great central location on the strip- Love the Forum shops- It's classic Caesars... yes the Wynn and the Palazzo are swankier, but there's something nice about the history here.Cons:- They charge for everything... wish they would provide free internet- The fridge is filled with their items on sensor - we moved stuff aroudn for our own items and had to get the bill adjusted at the end- Pools currently closed for renos - I suspect it'll be nice when they're doneI enjoyed it and was glad we got the upgrade after reading horror stories about the standard rooms. Would come back again.

Mar 7 2009 	Overpriced	I was booked by my company to the Roman Tower. When I stepped out of the cab, there was no one to assist you. The nearest elevator from the Registration was broken. It was a maze and a long walk to the next set of elevators but no bell boy was in sight as I dragged my 45 lb. luggage. From inside my room, I can hear the slamming of doors outside, talking in the next rooms as well as the alarm getting off from the next door. The room is spacious though and the amenities provided were good.To use the internet, it costs $25 per day and to use the gym, it is $45 a day. I think these services should have been included in the per night cost.The hotel is gorgeous though but I value my room more since I don't gamble.I transferred to Stratosphere after my conference. I find it much better for the price.

Feb 28 2009 	Wonderful stay--would do it again in a heartbeat!	A friend and I were in Las Vegas for a great 4 days. We throughly enjoyed our stay at Caesar's. I'm usually in Vegas two to three times a year and this was my first time staying at the Palace. The front desk staff was wonderful !!! Room service was great--our food came in less time than was predicted and was piping hot and very,very good. The location is great !!!  When we were checking in we were given an upgrade to the Augustus Tower and our room overlooked the Bellagio Fountains---What a great view!!!! After a long day of walking the strip it was great to relax in the spa tub.  I absolutely love Caesar's and will probably stay there again on my next trip out !!!!!!

Feb 24 2009 	Thank you Trip Advisor Members: Caesars Vegas!!	Many thanks to the Trip Advisor Members. I read many reviews before heading to Vegas and the tips really helped. ROOM: Requested Augustus Tower per your reviews. Room was modern and lovely. People were complaining about the Roman Tower but I wasn't there because of your reviews. HOTEL: Beautiful. Tables were mostly $25 blackjack but you're just across the street from O'Sheas. Your True Rewards card works there too so whether you want high end or low end tables, they are right across the street from each other.CHECK IN: As per your reviews, check in was a nightmare...but we were mentally prepared. They have clearly cut back on staff and waiting 45 minutes for your room (at 10pm) is never good, but after reading your reviews I expected it. Those who hadn't been forewarned were FREAKING OUT in line. Especially the older people, my god there were some people flipping. A hotel of this caliber shouldn't let this happen, but with the economy in the dumps (especially in Vegas) you've got to assume there are going to be some cutbacks. Again, inexcusable but at least a bit understandable.DINNER: Rao's. UNREAL. If you're trashing Rao's in a review then perhaps you didn't know what you were getting into. Food there is top notch. No one wants to pay $48 for Veal Parm but when it's the best you've ever had....$48 seems like $10.

Feb 23 2009 	Word of Advice	Last July, my girlfriend and I booked a room at Caesar's Palace through Yahoo! Travel. We booked a standard room with a free upgrade. When we got to the hotel I mentioned the free upgrade to the guy at check-in and he said that they didn't have any more available for the upgrade we had booked. The hotel didn't seem that busy to me so I'm not sure why they didn't have an available room. Fortunately, my girlfriend is very attractive (I don't know how I managed to get her LOL) and happened to be wearing a very big QVC canary diamond ring. The guy obviously noticed it and made a comment about it. Then he said that he would make a call and see what he could do about the upgrade. After getting off the phone, he gave us our keys and told us to enjoy our stay. He also suggested we eat at Joe's Stone Crab, which we did do and really enjoyed. We didn't know what to expect when we got to our room because he didn't tell us if we were upgraded or not. We were very pleasantly surprised to see that he had upgraded us to a suite. The room had been completely remodeled, with flat screen, new furniture, great view, very comfortable bed, etc..... Moral of the story is..............if you are physically attractive and treat employees at Caesar's Palace or any hotel/casino for that matter, with kindness and respect, you will enjoy your stay and may even get more than you ever expected. I could have easily started making demands and started complaining about how I had just driven for 4 hours and created a scene, when he told me there were no rooms available, but I didn't. I just acted like it was no big deal and because of that, he was willing to help out. I would strongly recommend staying here, everything was great. I strongly recommend Pure if you are in the 21-30 demographic. If you come to Caesar's and expect to pinch pennies........don't. There are places like Imperial Palace and Palace Station for that.

Feb 23 2009 	I like Caesar's	This was my third time in Vegas. Stayed at T.I. and Monte Carlo in the past. Caesar's was definitely my favorite of the three. I booked a standard room in the Roman Tower via hotel.com for $90/night. There seemed to be overwhelming disapproval of these rooms from other members on this site, so I upgraded at the front counter to the Palace Tower. We tried to talk the front desk attendant into a free upgrade, but to no avail. We paid an extra $60/night, which was supposedly a great deal - a result of the bad economy. Speaking of the economy, I didn't notice much of a difference in the amount of people visiting over the weekend. The nightclubs, etc. were still packed/hectic. Anyway, our room was great! Very spacious and extremely clean. I'm not much of a gambler, but the casino was essentially smoke-free compared to some of the other hotels. I always visit Caesar's for the mall and nightclubs, but had been unable to stay in the past due to the high rates. I was very excited to be able to stay this time, and would do so again if given the opportunity. (I'm giving the hotel 4/5 stars - but keep in mind this is based primarily off my Palace Tower room. If the Roman Tower is as bad as others' claim it to be, I'm sure my opinion would change. FYI the pool is closed. Try the restaurant across from the front desk for great late night dining.)

Feb 22 2009 	Caesar's: overpriced poor service	We just returned from 4 nights at Caesar's, the first hotel in Vegas that ever made me consider checking out early. It is amazingly overpriced - equivalent or superior rooms and amenities are available just about everywhere else on the strip. For the price, the room was very small. It also had a huge shower with more than enough room for a tub - something I always look forward to using on vacation - but instead there was only some pseudo-roman bathing bench. The TV was in pretty bad shape, about the worst signal I've seen on a hotel flatscreen. No changing of the sheets either, though unfortunately that seems to be the norm these days.When we checked in, we discovered that our minibar was not working. After three calls and at least two visits to the room, it was finally fixed. Upon checkout we discovered that we were charged $400 for the entire contents of the minibar - presumably when they removed the contents to fix it. Thankfully they were willing to remove the charge, but it was just another step in incompetence for this hotel. Service was generally terrible overall. We called for a wake-up call our first morning, but we never received it. Lines for everything are incredibly long and move slowly. There is also no security anywhere here apparently - I don't know if they've cut back, but every other hotel I've ever been to in Vegas had guards checking room keys at the elevator banks. Not so at Caesar's, and by the looks of some of the casino patrons, we didn't exactly feel safe. Some kids were having a party on our floor one night, and playing bass so loud that our room was vibrating til 4 am - no response from security there, either.And on top of all this, Caesar's somehow remains one of the higher-priced hotels on the strip. I don't know how they can possibly keep it up with the standards they display. You can do much better (for a better price) at most other hotels, especially if you shop around - the Mirage, MGM Grand, The Venetian/Palazzo, Mandalay Bay or Paris would all be improvements over Caesar's.

Feb 21 2009 	Enjoyed the luxory but check your bill at check out.	We enjoyed our stay to the fullest. The room was fantastic and the staff were very friendly and helpful. There are a few buts, so keep watch for extra and unnecessary charges. At check-in we were offered the upgrade to a mini-suite for only $62 and that would include certain extras and a jacuzzi in the room. We declined. Guess what we got anyway.....a mini-suite with a jacuzzi in the room. Then we got lost and ended up in the wrong tower trying to find our room. The most helpful employee offered assistance and took us through a maze of behind the scenes corridors, hallways, elevators and so on. Before we knew it we were at our room. All the staff we encountered were so friendly and helpful in all aspects. Upon checking out we had charges for the minibar on our tab even though we didn't use anything. Here's the catch! If you lift something up out of the minibar to even look at it, you will be charged. There are sensors that detect when something has been lifted up. Pretty amazing. They took the charge off immediately when we brought it to their attention. Also here is a first. We ordered a movie to watch in bed one night which was great, but you better plan on watching it all in one shot. You don't get it for 24 hours and are not able to pick up where you left off the next morning if you fell asleep during the first time you tried to watch it. No going back. That was a first and I must say dissappointing feature they have incorporated. And last but not least, the free valet parking is a real treat in all the madness of staying on the strip. Just loved that feature. All in all our first time staying at Caesars was most enjoyable. The accomodations were very roomy with lots of little luxories, great room service even though a little pricey, but hey, its Caesars and the breakfast really was delicious. We got a package deal on this stay which was one of the best anyone in Vegas had ever heard of. Oh yeah, the one real let down is the crazy fee they charge to use the fitness room facilities. $45 for an hour workout on their equipement. Sorry that is not a good service at all. We did not pay for that.

Feb 18 2009 	Caesar's Palace is Extraordinary!	Booked trip via expedia and was originally booked into a Classic room in the Roman tower. After reading many reviews about the older tower I knew we couldnt let the hotel room ruin our very first Vegas vacation.Checked in late on Thursday night of the Valentine's/Presidents Day long weekend. Check in line was short and we reached the front in about 10 minutes. I slipped the girl a twenty with my ID and credit card and asked if there were any upgrades available. To my delight we were upgraded to a Deluxe room in the Palace tower.The room was outstanding! What a fantastic upgrade. Two sinks in the HUGE bathroom, Jacuzzi tub, separate shower and private toilet. The bedding was very luxurious, carpets and linens were so clean! It felt like we were the first to stay in the room. The view wasnt great, we looked out over on the pool construction and the Octavius tower construction, but that was a small inconvenience. The pool was closed for renovations, but it was not warm enough to be taking advantage of that anywways.Housekeeping were courteous and very friendly. Our room was immaculate each time we returned. Top notch staff at this amazing hotel!Had room service on the first morning for breakfast. Wait time was about an hour for the food, but it came up piping hot and delicious. Prices were a little high but this is Vegas after all. Payards Pastierre was also a great place to get coffee in the morning, line ups can get a bit long. But again, its Vegas and thats to be expected.We signed up for the rewards card and got food vouchers for Caesars restaurants. Together with comps that we had gotten for playing at the tables one night, we had over $100.00 in food vouchers. We used them at Augustus Caf, which is the 24 hour restaurant located in the base of the Augustus tower. The food was delicious and the portions were very large. We both had enough left over for a midnight snack and the meal was essentially free. Definitely sign up for the rewards card to get all kinds of coupons and savings at Caesars.The gaming area is huge, but the minimum bets on most of the tables are very high. We went across to the Flamingo for lower limits. Also checked out Pure nightclub with the VIP passes received at check in. Very swanky club, but the drink prices were astronomical. Will probably do a bottle service with more people if we return.Caesars location cannot be beat, right in the middle of the strip. We walked everywhere. The Forum shops were fun to walk through, very high end merchandise. The Fashion Show mall across from Treasure Island is where we did a bulk of our shopping.My boyfriend golfed at the Balli Hai golf course and raved about it the entire trip. It was the highlight of the weekend for him and he greatly recommends this course to golfers. It was a short cab ride from the hotel and club rentals are available.The only complaint I have about Caesars is that the mini bar in the room was sensored. I had been taking out items in order to store personal water bottles and food, but once an item is removed you are charged for it. I noticed this upon checkout and the charges were removed from the bill. I will definitely stay at Caesars again but will not settle for anything less than the Palace tower.

Feb 16 2009 	Lost its luster	Never again. The ventilation in the casino is awful. Pure cigarette smell. They tried to put us in the Roman Tower but I had read to many bad reviews so I asked for the Augustus which was sold out. They had the Palace Tower available for a $40.00 upcharge. COME ON. The rooms were very well appointed but dirty and already looking worn. I don't think they vacuumed once when we were there. (we monitored nuts that we hadn't eaten remain the whole trip). There were urine and throw up stains on the wallpaper in the commode area as well as water stains on the silk bedskirt. Our toilet wouldn't flush one day and when maintenance fixed it they said housekeeping uses bars of soap to clean the toilets because the hotel doesn't provide enough cleaning supplies. Sure enough a bar of soap was caught inside. Concierge was soooooo slow and inept. There was no security anywhere. The spa was beautiful and well appointed that was the highlight. No plans on going back; ever.

Feb 16 2009 	do not upgrade	I upgraded to a deluxe room on hotels. com , for a 5 day stay, the front desk put us at the forum tower I told the desk clerk that this was incorrect I booked a room in the Palace or August Tower. After that I asked for a room on a high floor the clerk gave us the 51 floor really 2 floor. Treated like a second class no third class person because i booked on hotels.com. Overall the room was nice the TV didn't work the whole time. Room was extremely clean and maid was the friendlest person that worked their. After I got home have sent them a e-mail demanding a refund for the different rate in rooms. Hotel is nice just be careful at check in and demand what you paided for extremely arrogent front check in desk. Room was decorated nicely and the bed was extremely comfortable.

Feb 16 2009 	Gitcha A_ _ back in the room!	We go to Vegas 1 to 2 times a year for fun and business. Feb 16 2009 	Caesar's was great!	We booked a package through WestJetVacations.com. We chose Caesar's because we took it to be a fine hotel in the middle of the strip where all the action is. This was a blessing in itself after a long day of travel. The room was very nice. Two separate bathrooms, a shower built for two, a huge jacuzzi tub and a very spacious room. The bed was comfortable and the bedding was inviting and clean. We loved this hotel and highly recommend it to anyone.We stayed in the Palace Tower. If the pool was open, the Palace Tower is the place to be, it is located right beside the pool area. The casino staff was fun and friendly. Check out the Pussycat Dolls area!The only thing I can say that was a pain was the distance to the tower but one could complain about that with any large hotel on the strip. Feb 16 2009	Love Caesars'  just a few things you should know	Caesars' Palace is a Las Vegas legend and even though it doesn't have a 5 star or 5 diamond rating, i still consider it to be a very high class and luxurious destination. However, there are a few things you should know in order to make sure you have a good experience here. Let me start off with accommodations. The Augustus Deluxe, Palace Deluxe, and Palace Premium rooms are the best rooms you could find at Caesars' and are also the newest. The rooms in the Augustus tower are brand-new and the Palace tower rooms are remodeled to resemble the Augustus tower with only a few minor differences. These rooms are very nice, with spa tubs, and contemporary designs. The beds are fantastic and very comfortable. Also the rooms are a very good size, but you must know that the Augustus tower rooms have a different bathroom than the regular Palace room and the premium Palace room. The Augustus bathroom is roomier with a different design and a flat screen TV. The Palace tower bathrooms are the original Caesars' bathrooms from before the remodel which are still very nice but sometimes they are not in the best condition. The Palace Premium room is a very nice room, but in my opinion not worth the extra price per night, if you're comped this room then great, but otherwise it is not worth it. The only significant difference is that the Premium room has his and her bathrooms, no biggie. For some reason, Caesars' decided to go with the cheesy modern designs in the Forum Tower remodel just like the rest of Vegas is doing. I wouldn't recommend staying in these rooms unless you like the style or you get a very good deal, since at least they are brand new. Under NO circumstances should you ever book a room in the Roman or Centurion towers at Caesars', i am being very serious, those rooms are in horrible conditions, almost motel 6 status. If the "Classic" room is the only thing available, you should try the Wynn/Encore down the street, or Bellagio if they have a good deal. Also most of the time Caesars' is a little overpriced when it comes to rooms, be careful. Sometimes a classic room at Caesars' turns out to be the same price or more as a room at the Bellagio or a suite at Encore on a weeknight. Now lets move onto dinning. Caesars' has a very large selection of dinning choices. If you are on a tight budget however, i suggest either sticking to the Augustus Cafe, or dinning somewhere else. Because the fine dinning is amazing at Caesars' but the casual stuff, not so much. Stay away from the Cafe Lago buffet, trust me. It has a very small selection, overpriced, and isn't even that good. If you want great food try Spago, Sushi Roku, BOA, Trevi, Neros, and Bradley Ogden. Those are all great choices.As for the pool, its pretty chill and relaxing. Nice environment, large area, just nothing too special. Perfect place to lounge around and have a drink, or read a book.Also you should know that a tip a Caesars' goes a long way. When you're checking in, slipping a 50 or a 100 in with you I.D. and Credit Card could score you a beautiful suite. Most of the time if you ask "What can you do for me?" they'll even give you a choice. I have always had a comped stay at Caesars' but i have been upgraded by tipping a 50 from an Augustus Deluxe room to a one bedroom suite in the Augustus tower. It all depends on how you approach the front desk and how your attitude is. Be very friendly, and you'll always get what you want.That is about it, i know a lot about this property so please trust my advice and don't make any mistakes that could leave a bad impression of Caesars' in your mind.

Feb 14 2009 	Not a good place to stay - NOT going back to Caesars	Got a good last minute rate, and said WOW, gotta try Caesars. We cancelled Paris.... The room had two other doors to two adjacent rooms, and you could hear every word from the other rooms as the doors had no bottom seals. Feb 13 2009 	Mixed reviews	We got a good rate on this hotel by monitoring the website. We booked once and cancelled to take advantage of better rates. The Augustus Tower is in a good location compared to the casino/bars/restaurants/strip. We were on the 34th floor looking out at the Bellagio. We could see the fountain show and had a decent view fo the strip. Our room was nice. It had two beds, couch, cofee table, mini dining table and a nice flat screen tv. The bathroom was big and had a little tv in it, a seperate closet for the comode, and a seperate tub/shower. I have three concerns with the room: 1)The room did not seem clean. There was a lot of dust and the bathroom felt dirty. 2) The linens were old and worn. The bath towels were very old and borderline nasty. They reminded me of the towels my health club provides...not nice and very worn. The sheets were also worn and flimsy. 3) Room service was disgustingly priced. The delivery time was about 45 minutes and that I can understand. But to charge $70 for a few bagels/cream cheese and some juice and coffee is absurd and almost criminal:)The Casino was fun and we usually had no trouble getting drinks. We both broke about even playing blackjack and went on some legendary runs. Real fun. The restaurants were unbelievable. We ate dinner at Raos(pronounced Ray-ohs), Joes in the Forum Shops, and Bobby Flays Mesa Grille for lunch. I will be doing reviews of all three of them shortly so look for those but lets say they were all good with Joes and Raos being the best! The best thing to me about Caesars is the location. It is smack dab in the center of the strip and you can walk everyhwere.I would stay at Caesars again but only in a new room as I have heard the older ones are pretty bad. However, next time I go I will have lowered expectations of the rooms.

Feb 13 2009 	My Most Favorite Hotel in Vegas	I have stayed at many great hotels but I will always love CP the best. Steakhouse has great coconut shrimp & don't forget to try their Strawberry TALL Cake~trust me, it's an experience! Get up to Mt. Charleston & rent a log cabin as a fun getaway..Bonnie Springs, Nevada has a zoo...I love Vegas and loved showing my husband all around Nevada.

Feb 12 2009 	Girlfriends' Weekend at Caesar's Palace	I was frankly a litle wary of staying at Caesar's Palace, based on many of the Trip Advisor reviews, but a girlfriend booked the trip, so off we went. Feb 12 2009 	Caesars is an attitude	The place has always had a little Sinatra swagger to it, reminiscent of Vegas in its halcyon days. It used to be unique, but other high-end properties like Mandalay Bay, Wynn, and the Venetian have caught up and even surpass it. She's kind of like Ingrid Bergman or Sophia Loren in their fifties -- still eminently presentable, but her best days are certainly behind her.The rooms are smart, comfortable, and well-appointed, though some of the older ones sport a view so poor, you'll want to keep the drapes closed. If you have a choice, opt for the Palace (first choice) or Augustus (second) Tower.By far the best amenity is still the pool. The drinks are expensive ($17 for a Caesars' Lemonade -- nicely spiked, of course), but you'll want to indulge. Service can be spotty at times -- truth be told, that millstone could be hung around all Harrah's properties -- but it is tends to be better than most. We have our favorite restaurants in Vegas, but it just so happens that none of them happen to be in Caesars, so even though we have stayed there at least a dozen times over the years, we can't express an informed opinion. Their spa and fitness club deserves a major-league demerit. It doesn't come close to measuring up to Mandalay Bay's -- and isn't much better than you find at Harrah's or the Rio -- but they have the audacity to charge for use of the shower facilities, even for their Diamond Club members. "We're Caesars. We're better than you." The swagger can be endearing up to a point, but borders on the annoying.Caesars has grown almost by accident, and not according to any coherent plan. It has a few annoying quirks, such as a Diamond check-in area in a place where you can no longer drive to; after parking in the valet, you have to walk half-way around the property with luggage in tow. It's not a major concern for the casual traveler, although check-in lines for the average customer can be unduly extreme for a high-end property. Expect a long wait. A stroll through the Forum Shops is a delightful way to return from the Strip, but the only people who shop there have more money than sense. The Fashion Show Mall is just a short walk down the Strip, and a better place to indulge.

Feb 10 2009 	On to be caesar	Firstly, can't believe I forgot to write review until now, most have been too busy telling everyone in person that we loved caesars!Stayed for two nights mid-week in November for our first trip to Vegas.Booked through travel agent, who booked through agency etc, so the hotel had problem tracking down our reservation initially. We appreciate these things happen, but the wonderful girl checking us in was very apologetic and got it sorted as quickly as possible. She also arranged an upgrade to the Augustus Towers overlooking the Bellagio Fountains for a knockdown price. The room, as mentioned by other posters is huge and the bathroom larger than many standard hotel rooms. So good we often felt bad for leaving. The rest of the hotel, if you can get around to all of it, is superb, and only regret is that we didn't have more time there.

Feb 9 2009 	Inept Management Don't Stay at Caesars	I still find it unbelievable that I, and many others, had to wait over an hour to check in to Caesars Palace in Las Vegas on February 4, 2009. Hotel Management didnt really seem to care that the line was extremely long. There was a hotel employee handing out water bottles, but when I asked for a cocktail or glass of wine I was denied. Would it have killed management to have the same employee pushing a cart with beer and wine for people waiting in line? When I finally got to the front of the line there was uncertainty related to whether I was going to get the room that I had a written confirmation for at the agreed upon price. The front desk employee told me that all of the rooms at your price are sold out, as if it was my fault. They asked me to pay extra to get into their next tier room. They still didnt apologize for the hour-long wait. They didnt offer a $50 hospitality credit to be used in a Caesars restaurant or bar for my time waiting in line. They were asking me for more money, which I refused. After a while they then accommodated me in another room, which was a normal room. It was as if Caesars had never checked in a large group of people before. It was amateur hour, and from speaking to other members of my group the line existed all day long. I thought I was in a Seinfeld episode.When the room was cleaned any dirty glasses or dishes were not removed from the room.The pool area was closed for renovation. Upon check out there was a $25 mini bar charge on my bill. I didnt even open the door of the mini bar. As soon as I mentioned this, the charge was removed. Nice try Caesars, but I look at my bill.My advice to meeting planners, no matter where you stay, is to write in to the contract a penalty clause if the wait is over X number of minutes, the hotel owes each guest who waited longer than the agreed upon minutes a certain number of dollars. If the guest gets bumped to another hotel, their stay at the other hotel is free. In the age of computers there is no excuse to overbook a hotel and for there to be extra long check in lines. It is absurd. Caesars has clearly forgotten which industry they are in, its called hospitality. I would not recommend this hotel until it is sold to someone who cares about their guests.John PorrielloWethersfield, CT

Feb 8 2009 	Long lines no coffee and upcharges for even the basics	Stayed Feb 2-6. Hoping for some comfort at a first class hotel after a chaotic day of airports and shuttle busses? Not even close. I arrived to find a line at the check-in that wrapped back and forth thru the lobby then down the hall to the shopping area. Waited over an hour. Velvet ropes were set up to manage the crowd - apparently this is a daily event. No apologies to the guests; no refreshments while waiting; no management to acknowledge that this was apalling for a $250+ per night "first class" hotel. And where was the bell staff to help guests to their rooms?For business travelers here for conferences, not for leisure, the hotel experience falls way short of expectations. Many of the basics that business travelers expect are absent . No newspapers for guest rooms. Internet access is $14.95 for 24 hours. It's $25 a day to use the fitness center. It's $5 for a kiosk to print your boarding pass. Good luck getting a cup of coffee in the morning. There are no in-room coffee machines, no free coffee in the lobby, and the coffee shop didn't open until 7 AM, too late for most conference goers. The only place I could get a cup each morning was in a bar in the casino area for $4 plus tip. When I asked the desk, they suggested that I order coffee via room serivce - but it would cost $11 plus $5 delivery fee plus 18% gratuity plus taxes.Everyone in my conference of 300+ people was buzzing about the check in debacle, and many of them waited the hour in line just to find that the hotel was oversold and they were bumped to another hotel. Even our keynote speaker, an expert on marketing of service businesses, commented about the hotel's shamefully bad customer service. I believe that Caesars Palace was once a fine hotel with a reputation for luxury, but clearly it has lost its way. I would never consider a return visit.

Feb 8 2009 	Awesome!	First time in Vegas, and decided to go to a great hotel, and great it was. Feb 7 2009 	Excellent Location on the Strip	This was my second trip to Vegas and went with a small group of friends. We picked Caesar's because of the location on the strip (right in the center).We arrived late in the evening (8:30 PM), but there was no line at the check-in counter and they gave us a free upgrade without asking to the Augustus tower which is one of the newer towers on the south end of the property (closest to check-in counter) when we had booked a Forum tower. The room was a nice upgrade and we had an amazing view of the Bellagio fountains.The room was great, can't complain at all.The Casino is probably my favorite one in all of Vegas, though my only complaint is that the Poker Room is an 'after though' with a separate maze to go thru to get to it.The food court in the Casino is a bit overpriced, but a better option then nothing at all. They only had one open at that time of year, so I'm sure it's better in the summer. I'm going again this May so will find out then.

Feb 4 2009	Not Worth The Money 	I stayed in the hotel from Jan. 29-Feb. 1, 2009. This trip was meant to be a friend's birthday weekend celebration that we planned for months. One of the friends that came on the trip was stuck to a wheechair due to a leg injury a few weeks before. Our flight coming in arrived at 8:00am so we went to the hotel and tried to check in early. The line up was very long, but we did come early and a lot of people were checking out so that did not bother me too much. After about 20 minutes it was out turn and we asked if it was possible to check in early. They said that they would accomodate us for an early check in, and came up with 3 rooms on the same floor in the Roman Tower. I asked if there were any rooms available for an upgrade, and the lady said that they were full capacity due to the Super Bowl Weekend. We made our way to the Roman Tower and were disappointed from the time we stepped off the elevators. The hallways were very outdated, there was garbage everywhere, there was a glass in every single corner of the hallway and not to mention it smelled of mold. Our rooms were nothing short of a motel! The bedrooms had no closets, the bathroom door was glass as was the wall that looked into the bedroom, so if you took a bath or a shower, who ever is in the living room can see you. We were a little disappointed but kind of debated whether to say anything, we figured we would not spend too much time in the rooms. The only other issue was that getting around in a wheelchair was almost impossible because the hallways were tiny. We decided not to say anything and were tired from being up at 3am having to make our flight that morning. Within 30 minutes we realized that there was no way we were staying in those rooms. The floors were not vacuumed as there were sunflower seeds and chips on the floor. The bathroom had not been cleaned and had soap residue on the tub as well as the sink. There was garbage on the bathroom floor and the garbage cans were not emptied. One of the rooms had (I assume by the looks of it) pubic hair in the bathtub. The ceilings and walls were mirrored, and there was a thick layer of dust on everything in the room. We immediately got on the phone, complained about everything and were told that we had to wait until noon. During that time we went for some lunch in the food court and waited for the managers. They upgraded us to the Palace Tower which was a deluxe room, very nice looking and definitely clean! The only problem was that the Tower was on the whole other side of the hotel, and had to wheelchair her through the entire hotel and casino. We took it as it is and were extremely happy with the new accomodations. But only for a short while... Their housekeepers clean rooms starting between 7am-8am, every morning. They do not care if the DO NOT DISTURB sign is hung, they will still knock. Every morning I would open the door and say, please come back after 10, and they would knock half an hour later. At check out, we had not only been charged things that we did not even touch or were not there when we checked in, but they cut off our room keys hours before our check out time. Their staff is so slow and although they are semi friendly, they are not fit to run a hotel of that size with the attitude of "There is nothing we can do". I would advise to stay at the Caesar's Palace and only to the Palace or Augustus Tower if the prices are unbeatable. There are way cheaper hotels for the same location such as Bally's, Imperial Palace, and Flamingo, so why over pay if you are getting the same service as a lower grade accomodation.

The safe was in the floor, and the glasses and ice bucket were on the safe -- so when I hung up my clothes, they hung down over the ice bucket and glasses!Amusing, huh? But I could live with that. That night when I took my shower, I pulled out the shower curtain -- the bottom was yellow and spotted with mildew stains -- a lovely contrast to the bright white of the rest of the curtain. Kind of disgusting, but it was bed time, so I just made it quick!Went over to turn on the bedside lamp -- no working light bulb. But it's bedtime, and I can't deal with changing rooms. So I call and leave a message asking for the lightbulbs to be replaced and the shower curtain to be replaced the next day. Of course, there's nothing that can be done about the huge gaping pull in the carpet, except maybe cover it with duct tape --- which would be a cosmetic improvement!At lunch, I came back to the room to work on my computer -- this is a business trip after all -- and guess what -- there were NO outlets anywhere near the desk. I go down again, and the young woman is very gracious and gives me an upgrade "at no cost, since I've had so much trouble". I go check out my new room in the Palace Tower, which is very nice -- complete with outlets by the desk so you can plug in your computer and Blackberry!I go back to my room to move my stuff -- I didn't want to wait for the bellman -- packed it all up, got back to the new room, and the key didn't work! Housekeeping will not let you in and told me to call security, who had no idea when they could be there, and said it would be quicker for me to go back to the front desk. So -- only stay there if you are guarenteed that you are NOT in the Roman Tower! They should be embarrased to send guests there -- another woman told me there was no door on her bathroom! It is truly not an exaggeration to say that the Roman Tower is like staying in the Motel 6 with a casino! But if you are in any other other Towers, I think you would find them to be very nice and very much what you expect for a resort hotel or a conference hotel.

Got in at early at 1:30 pm and checked in although confirmation letter adamantly said 4 pm or after. There was absolutely no waiting in line and when we discovered we were booked into the Palace, we just asked if there were any rooms available in the Augustus, overlooking the Bellagio fountains and possibly adjoining. We shot for the moon. The clerk checked and said no problem. With no extra money nor tipping necessary, we got two adjoining rooms with two queen beds each on the 38th floor, overlooking the fountains and strip headon. Gorgeous! The rooms were spacious, clean and well appointed; the beds and linen luxurious and the bathrooms outstanding. Just loved the flat screen tv in the gleaming bathroom. Maid service was prompt and wonderful. Ate at the Augustus cafe in their banquet room and it was very, very good for our large group. Bette Midler was fantastic. Casino very smokey and there was a funny oder by the Roman tower entrance. I think it was from the proximity of the chocolate shop nearby and mixing with the smokey air. Weird smell. Loved our stay. Staff professional, excellent and attentive.

Jan 29 2009 	How much was that room????	When we arrived to checkin at Caesar's Palace, there was a long line of people ahead of us. We couldn't figure out why the line was moving so slow until it was our turn at the front desk.We had booked an incredible deal for the room rate on the hotel's website. But the person at the reception desk seemed determined to make us spend more.He pulled out a book and started trying to talk us into different rooms. After flying for about 6 hours, we weren't really in the mood for this, but he was persistent.He finally showed us a room and said we could have it for $30.00. Of course, that sounded ridiculous, but I kept asking him over and over again and he kept saying $30.00.During our stay, I tried to check the room rate on the customer service channel and it never showed up.But when we checked out, we realized that they had charged us an "upcharge" of $30 per night for the room we stayed in.Two more things. Although listed as an amenity on the website, there is a charge of $14.99 a day for wireless internet. AND we were charged a room service charge for several items from the room that we did not use. (The customer support people on the phone were very cooperative about refunding us the money for the room service items).Was the room worth the money? Other than the fact that the shower didn't drain and we were standing in ankle deep water every time we showered, it was a pretty nice room. However, I doubt that it was really any nicer than the original room that we had booked over the internet.

Jan 28 2009 	awesome hotel!	what a fantastic hotel! cant praise it enough....we stayed for week, wish it could have been longer, the room was amazing, huge bed massive bathroom (tv in the mirror etc) very plush, and to top it off we had direct views over the bellagio water fountains!!so if you book there make sure you ask for the augustus tower, as thats the newest one with all the amazing views of the fountain and strip..its a very plush hotel but not at all snotty, which is a bonus. the decor is great it all looks fresh, the food was fantastic, portions are huge, casino is awesome..i cant say enough nice things about it, staff are very helpful and there is every facility available that you could need!

Jan 26 2009 	Caesars was nice but will stay somewhere else next trip	My husband I went to Las Vegas October 1-5th 2007. We stayed all four nights at Caesars Palace in the new Augustus Tower. This section was very close to the main lobby and very easy to get to.Our room was beautiful and had a nice view of the strip. We could see the pool when looking to left out of our window. We ate at Rao's our first evening there, the restaurant was vey busy so we sat at the Bar and had a wonderful dinner. The bartender was excellent and very helpful with our ordering. We had breakfast one morning at the Payard Bistro. My husband and I both had chocolate and banana waffle. These waffles were soggy and dripping with chocolate. I do not recommend this Bistro to anyone. Menu very limited and expensive. We had a quick bite to eat at the Augustus Cafe located right next to the lobby. Very good burgers and appetizers at a good price. The pool at Caesars was a big disappointment. They are adding on to the hotel so they have barrier walls set up around the pool. In fact it seems the new addition is going to be blocking the sun from the pools. The pool does not see good sunlight until 1pm or so. We gambled at Caesars a few nights, the hotel is huge so it didn't seem overcrowded. Overall the hotel was nice, nice and bright, and friendly staff.

Jan 26 2009 	Forget Hail Caesar I suggest hailing a cab elsewhere	I was at Casears for 4 days over New Years. I have stayed here before so I knew there is a MAJOR difference between their newer towers and their old towers in terms of rooms. The old tower is like a Holiday inn from the 1980's. When I checked in, there was no room available where I had booked AND prepaid. So, they said they would only charge me the going rate for the old tower they were putting me in. Say what? Are you kidding with me? ONly charge me for what you are providing even though what your providing isn't what I booked and prepaid for?They agreed to switch my room the next day. It gets better, they move me into a new room and when I get there someone else is in inside! I kid you not.I would NEVER stay here again. Go to Bellagio, Wynn, Encore, even the Venetian for a high end strip hotel. But I'd avoid Casears. If you do stay here don't say I didn't warn you.Upside is easy access to shopping.

Jan 21 2009 	Nice if you get the right room.	A friend of mine checked in the day before me. He requested, and received without a problem, an upgrade to a nice, new room. (I was already paying $210 per night, which is clearly not a rock bottom price).They put me in the Roman Tower. An old tower which an employee told was supposed to be subject to EXTENSIVE renovations, but they put it on hold because of the economy. In the meantime, it's smelly and tired. (IMPORTANT TIP: When you check in avoid letting them put you in the Roman Tower).After a couple of days in the Roman Tower, I got a call from the front desk telling me that there was apparently a leak in my room, affecting the room below me, and that I was gonig to have to move. I was then moved to the Palace Tower; a tower which has been renovated. Much better. Friends of mine told me that Augustus Tower is even better.It's probably typical everywhere in Vegas, but I don't like the fact that they don't have coffee makers in the room or an affordable place to get a quick snack. The breakfast buffet (which was impressive indeed) was $25. I ate way too much to justify the fact that I was spending so much on breakfast. The next morning, even a bran muffin and a glass of orange juice was over $10.If you want to live it up big and are willing to pay the price to do so, this is a good spot. The shops in the Forum are all ultra high end, as are most of the restaurants.As long as your expectations are for the high end and can avoid the Roman Tower, you should enjoy yourself.

Jan 14 2009 	1st Trip To Vegas	My wife and I stayed at Caesar's from Jan. 10th Sat. until Jan. 13th Tuesday. We arrived approximately 4 hours early for check-in, but that seemed to be no problem. We decided to visit/gamble at several of the other casinos and found Caesar's to be in at least the top 3, if not the best. I recommend that staying at Caesar's should be top priority while in Vegas. I also forgot to mention that we arrived at Caesar's on Saturday and that we booked our entire trip on Friday. I could not have been more pleased that a trip planned a few hours before arrival went this well.Side notes: Casino- had fun, loved the wheel of fortune machines, but lost about $2,600.Restaurants- worst part about Caesar's, overpriced and bad food.Hotel Room- top notch. Nov 19 2009 	Home away from home	Stayed at the Cancun for 3 days as the kids were nagging us to see Hoover Dam. Was surprised of the quality of the rooms. The room was clean and modern with huge spa baths adjoined to each room. My biggest gripe was that there was no free wireless internet and was expensive at $9.95 per day. Nov 17 2009 	a pleasent stay at Cancun Resort ( a time share)	my husband and i checked in on a tuesday evening- the room was nice- king sized bed and tv in bedroom / a couch that pulls out and a chair and tv in livingroom- a dinning table for 4 & a full kitchen- stove, dishwasher, microwave, full size fridge. we had two bathrooms- one off the livingroom- with a stand up shower and sink and toilet- the bigger bathroom was off the bedroom it had a two sinks, toilet and huge jetted tub for 2. everything was clean and tiddy except the carpet had stains in more than a few places throughout the villa. It was too cold to swim when we were there - but the pool looked beautiful from our balcony.i do have a suggestion for any single travelers- i would request to be in the main building - no one is at the doors in the parking garadges and we had a problem with a man pulling the door out of our hands cause he didn't have a room key and then proceeded to yell and act beligerant! security was called and never came- i went the next morning to complain that no one even took a reoport about this<Security was a joke- they didn't seam at all concerned and said i could fill out a report if i wanted to.this was free to us --as sister used her points- they tried to get us to listen to the time share pitch- but we declined!!!! sister joined us for a few days- she wasn't pleased with a few things as well. over all - a clean decent place to stay- way too far from all the fun. if you want it quiet and away from the action- then this is the place- but you couldn't pay me to stay there if i didn't have a rental car. the shuttle is a joke AND stops at midnight- and a cab four miles from mandalay bay- is Ridiculous!!!also they require a $100 deposit for god only knows what!

Nov 16 2009 	A Home away from home!!!	Beautiful Resort to stay in!! I really felt as if i was in CanCun, the pool is huge & so nice, My room was almost the size of my house. Nov 8 2009 	Great Place to Stay	Stayed at this hotel fo 2 days and had a great experience. The staff was friendly and helpful all around. Courtesy shuffle to The Strip was convenientThe resort is themed like a Mexican Resort and was impressive.Parking garage was locked at night and felt very secureFree internet would have been a bonus. Oct 28 2009 	Great Resort	We had a two bedroom two bath suite. This was fabulous for us - had a balcony, full kitchen, etc. Parking was a little difficult for those renting vehicles. The rooms are comfortable, well appointed. If you are looking for luxury and on the strip this is not it. It is up the strip a little away from the hussle and bussle. We did have a few issues with our room, but maintenance took care of it nearly immediately. Kitchen was a bit small but this suited what we wanted. A fabulous pool, some relaxation and close enough to the strip. You have to get to the pool early if you want a floaty - or cut a deal with someone to have theirs when they are done. Noodles are a plenty also. They have waterslides, pleasant music near the pool - did I mention the pool is spectacularly clean!! Great place for friends getaway, family trip, etc.

Oct 24 2009 	So glad we didn't stay on the strip lovely rooms great pool	After seeing the hotels with casinos on the strip and the amount of walking and vast lobbies we were so glad we stayed at the Cancun, which was so quiet, with lovely rooms a fantastic pool and parking convenient to each room. We liked it so much we returned for another 4 nights later in our holiday. The staff were friendly, the room was delightful and the beds comfortable. We had a small apartment (termed a villa), We had a central dining area with small kitchenette off. The small lounge area had a very comfy fold out queen bed for our son and he had his own bathroom whilst next door we had a nice spacious feeling master bedroom with a huge his and hers bathroom with ample spa bath. All in all we felt it a home from home and a retreat from a trip to the strip! We used the shuttle and also drove our car into the strip using I15 and found it easy to park in the casino parking. Across the road from the hotel is a good selection of eating places - much cheaper than the strip, plus a useful food store, gas station and pharmacy -- everything you could need. Recommend Outback Steakhouse, and IHOP for breakfast.

Oct 14 2009 	Not too bad...........	Before we went to the Cancun resort we read here how unfriendly the staff was, we didn't run into that at all. They were courteous and helpful at check in and assisted us with printing our boarding passes before we left. The condos themselves, at least the two bedroom we had, are smaller than the other condos where we have stayed. It was very clean though and quiet. But then this is Vegas and how much time are you going to be at your condo. The pool was absolutely beautiful but we couldn't figure out while the temperatures were in the mid 90's to low 100's the water felt as if it were about 60 degrees. We were not the only ones that thought the water was too cold. A couple of nights we did hear a few people that had been celebrating a little too much as they returned but only lasted a couple of minutes, and not that long after we returned for the evening. The resort is less than 10 minutes from the strip, we didn't use the shuttle at all and found that if you use back streets you can get to some of the parking decks at the casinos without having to deal with all the traffic of the strip. If you want to get away from all the glitz and glamour of the strip take a trip up to Freemont Street. Its old Vegas and is much more laid back than the strip and found it to be a pleasant change. Overall it is a nice resort and would return here again if we ever travel to Vegas again.

Sep 30 2009 	Very nice resort	My husband and I went to this resort last week-9/25. We booked a room through our timeshare and also got one for two of our friends. The pool was great too, although we were so busy we barely spent any time in it, except to try out the waterslides, which were awesome. The only downfall is that the hotel is about 3 miles from the strip. they advertise a shuttle, but it is VERY unreliable, and it only runs from 12-12. I would just rent a car next time. I will definately be back to the CANCUN RESORT!!!

Sep 17 2009 	Nice resort	We were in Vegas for my daughter's wedding the week of 9/6-9/13. I own a timeshare at Polo Towers but since they were full for the time I needed, I was able to exchange a banked week for my Mom and two brothers for the Cancun resort.While it quite a ways from the strip, it worked for us since I rented a car for the week. I don't know how people do it otherwise!We got a two bedroom, two bath unit on the 5th floor. Love the unit and the view of the mountains. Very happy with the resort all in all.We spent more time at the pool than I thought we would. The drinks were not too expensive considering what they charge on the strip. One vodka tonic was $5.50, but I WAS charged a $3.00 "up charge". What the heck?The restaurant food needs revamping, in a big way. They are seriously missing a great opportunity here. Someone from this resport should spend a few day in Mexico and see how they treat their guests and what kind of food/drinks they are serving. My goodness....It would be great to have fish taco's, tropical salads, fresh fruit & cheese platters offered to guests as they lounge around the pool. Why isn't anyone walking around the pool offering guests signature drinks. Lovely tropical drinks would be delightful. Instead, they had bar food fare; wings, french fries, nachos. The only thing I could find on the menu that wasn't fried was a turkey sandwich, and it was good.We own three timeshares and are able to move them (exchange) to various places all the time. Never ever have we been charged anything anywhere we have stayed. Only this resort charged us a $6.93 daily "Accommodation Tax". Weird.To leave this review on a possitive note, the property and the unit was very clean and spacious. Yes, the kitchen is rather small, but still functional.

Sep 3 2009 	Clean resort but would rather be closer to strip.	We purchased the timeshare from a friend who very nicely traded her timeshare in New Hampshire for the one at Cancun Resort. None of us had ever stayed here before, and were pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness and look of the hotel. We also liked the rooms and our view of the strip. However, if you are not traveling with kids, this may not be the place for you. Lots of rules, like only 1 float per room (there were 4 adults in our room), having to show ID to get horseshoe stuff. You are also charged $30 per week for wifi, which was unexpected. In the future, I would stay on the strip, even if I had to pay extra.

Aug 23 2009 	Great resort near the Las Vegas Strip!	Stayed the weekend here at the Cancun Resort before school started for the kids. There is nothing bad you can say about the hotel itself. The one bedroom villa was very clean (except for the fact that there was a couple of sunflower seeds near the balcony), pool area is very nice, and open amenities and lobby are nicely put together and clean. Housekeeping staff were also a little loud while in the elevator with them, and one housekeeper was painting her nails in the elevator! Another problem that I found at the resort is that it is not very kid friendly. The Caribe Lounge did not except minors into the restaurant so we couldn't eat their and were told to eat somewhere else. Aug 17 2009 	Incredible pool terrific rooms nice facilities	We planned to stay only two nights but enjoyed this hotel so much my wife and I called-in-sick to work to stay an extra night! We had a 1-bedroom unit. It was in excellent condition (new), nice furniture, well-stocked kitchen, large master bath, very very clean. The whole place smells good (which is important if you ever stayed in a place that smells funky).Our favorite part of the hotel was the pools. The pools themselves are large, complete with a waterfall you can swim under and waterslides. Aug 10 2009 	Excellent mini vacation	The resort is excellent, with only one negative comment which I will address first. They offer a complimentary shuttle to the strip. Later his wife walked by and made a snide comment to my husband in front of our kids. That experience really turned us off. We have never encountered someone like that on vacation. My husband and kids ate at the restaurant and said it was "okay" but overpriced. I thought we would utilize the kitchen but other than using the refrigerator for leftovers and making toast a few morning we didn't use the kitchen. We didn't use the shuttle because we like to be able to come and go as we please. Normally we stay in a hotel on the strip but decided to try a timeshare away from the strip. It didn't work for us. The kids really like being on the strip and because hotel rooms are so reasonable next time we will just stay on the strip. There were a lot of families with small children and I think this resort works great for them.

Jun 24 2009 	Good Stay	I recently returned from a trip to Las Vegas and my husband and I stayed at the Cancun Resort. Let me start with the grounds. It's a beautiful hotel and a very nice layout. It's located about 3.5 miles south of the strip and there is a shuttle that will take you to the Tropicana and back, but that ends at 12midnight. There was only one shuttle running and sometimes depending on traffic it was better to drive down yourself. If this is an issue I recommend you not stay here.  Our room was wonderful. The apholstery is a little outdated but we don't go to stay in the room so I don't worry too much. There was a kitchen, stove and all the necesities for those that want to eat in to save money. There are two bathrooms, and a whirlpool tub in the master bathroom. DON'T expepect housekeeping to come in every day. I didn't realize that when we booked but since we didn't need much we didn't really care. It's in their manual but I had overlooked it-no big deal to us. The pool is awesome and a great place to hang out for the day. Get there early if you want a great spot but there were plenty of lounge chairs during our visit. We visited the lounge and the food is ok for the price. The cafe was closed when we wanted to visit for breakfast but they recomended the lounge so that's where we ate. We were not harrased by the timeshare people. I didn't even see anyone there-however they are all over on the strip. Overall a great stay would do it again-next time we're bringing the kids.

Jun 9 2009 	Very nice stay	Our stay was arranged by friends who own the time share. We were checked in efficiently by the friendly staff and were surprised to find that our friends were kind enough to book us a penthouse! Most importantly, the beds were very comfortable and the place was dead quiet, probably the quietest hotel room I ever stayed in -- and that is saying something! That's mainly because you can't slam a door if you wanted - they have a mechanism that doesn't allow the door to slam. We loved going under the waterfall and I even went on the water slides and I am not exactly a spring chicken.We didn't eat there, so I can't comment on the food or the room service. Jun 7 2009 	Shouldn't you get BETTER service than the average hotel if you pay 10k?	Overall I was fairly disappointed in the Cancun resort. Shuttle Hours - Your in Las Vegas .. the strip is why many, many people come - your shuttle should run past 12AM. It would also be nice if they had 1-2 more stops. One in the Master Bedroom with a shower over a jacuzzi tub, and another off of the living room with just a shower. I work for Marriott and in the hospitality industry so I know what I'm looking for service wise - this staff didn't have it. Between each of the items (may I have an envelope, may I buy a stamp, can you make this and my Netflix please) the agent left me and went behind a door to continue her conversation with another staff member. The only POSITIVE staff I had interation with was the shuttle staff.Shuttle - It was a good to have the option but could be improved.Room - Kitchen should be larger.
